Supported platforms

This theme is mainly targeted at ROMs that are close to AOSP (pure Android), with the primary focus being on custom ROMs.
However, this theme might work as well on stock ROMs, as long as the vendor does not do too many modifications to the Android system and apps base (keep also in mind that when using stock ROMs, as well as custom ROMs without Substratum exposures, you will need to use legacy variants for a better experience).
If you experience issues while using a stock ROM other than when using a Google device (those are quite close to AOSP, so issues that occur here are likely to be present on other ROMs as well) that don\'t apply to 3rd party apps, I usually won\'t be able to provide support for it. However, since the theme is open source, you are welcome to look into fixing the bug yourself and creating a pull request for including it into feature releases.

Currently supported Android versions range from Android 7.0 (oldest Android version with Substratum support at the time of writing; in the past, Android versions since 5.0 were supported) to Android 8.1.

If you want to run this theme on Android 9.0 or later, it is recommended to use Default Dark\'s successor theme, DarkCroc theme.

Variants explained

Base variant

Notifications

Choose light notifications (default) to ensure readability for all applications (recommended especially when running Substratum in legacy mode). When using one of the dark/black solid/semi-transparent variants, issues might occur with apps that set their own notification colors.

Use legacy variants when using a ROM without full Substratum support (exposure commits), i.e. when using stock ROM!

Android System

Overlay type

  • Default: Use with Substratum-supported ROMs
  • legacy: Use when using a ROM without Substratum exposure commits

Backgrounds

  • Default: Default Material dark
  • Darker: Slightly darker but not black
  • Black: Completely black background
  • More black: Black background also for dialogs (e.g. the power menu on Android 7)
  • Transparent: Semi-transparent dialogs (e.g. the power menu on Android 7)

Settings accent

Accent color for Settings (default: teal)

System accent

Accent color for System/SystemUI.

Default: match settings. Default variant needed on some legacy ROMs such as LineageOS on which opening the power menu leads to a device reboot otherwise. If you don't experience reboots when using a different variant than the default one here, it's recommended to select the other variant.

Calculator

Android version

  • Default: Use when running Android 8.0 (Oreo) or later
  • android 7: Use when running older Android versions

Contacts

Android version

  • Default: Use when running Android 8.0 (Oreo) or later
  • android 7: Use when running older Android versions

Splash screen

  • Default: Use when the app doesn't show a splash screen (usually the case on Android 7.*)
  • Splash screen: Use when the app shows a splash screen on start (usually the case on Android 8.0 and later)

Email (AOSP)

  • Default: Readable on most devices.
  • theme ready: Use this if you have theme-ready AOSP Email(*).
  • theme ready dark mail: Use this if you have theme-ready AOSP Email(*) and want to have the mails you received dark as well (might not look well if the mail sets its own text colors)
(*) Known ROMs that include theme-ready AOSP Email:
  • AICP 12.1 builds starting from 2017-05-29

Style

  • Default (light): Ensure readability
  • Dark: Choose if darkness is more important to you than readability

Android version

  • Default: Use when running Android 8.0 (Oreo) or later
  • android 7: Use when running Android 7.* (Nougat)

App version

  • Default: Select if you don't have speed dial settings (e.g. AOSP)

Pixel Launcher

Style

  • Default (light): Ensure readability

SystemUI

Android version and QS/volume style

  • Default: Use when running Android 8.0 (Oreo) or later for default dark solid QS and volume
  • android 8…: Use when running Android 8.0 (oreo) or later Android versions (select QS/volume style as you wish)
  • android 7…: Use when running Android 7.* (nougat (select QS/volume style as you wish)

  • Default: Keep stock title size
  • Small: Reduce quicksettings title size a little bit

Reporting bugs

Before reporting any bugs, try following steps first:

  • Try rebooting your device after applying the theme
  • Make sure you are using the right variants
  • Make sure you are using the latest version of Substratum
  • Try uninstalling and re-installing the theme
  • Try cleaning the cache of Substratum (or the theming app that you're using)
  • Try uninstalling and re-installing Substratum
  • Check whether the issue already has been reported on the theme's github page and maybe there is already a known fix for it

When reporting bugs, please provide the following information:

  • ROM Version (stock ROM/custom ROM (which one)), Android version (?attr/androidVersion), release date for custom ROMs
  • Do you have full Substratum/OMS support or are you running Substratum in legacy mode?
  • Substratum version: ?attr/substratumVersion
  • Version of this theme: ?attr/themeVersion
  • The variants you selected
  • Information about your issue:
    1. If some colors are odd/texts are unreadable, please provide a screenshot and describe where it was taken!
    2. If an app crashes, please provide a logcat

To report a bug, create an issue on the github page (or provide additional information to an existing one).

Be nice! You don't pay me anything, and I don't feel the need to fix everything you tell me to; especially if you're not being friendly! Also, don't expect any response if you haven't provided the above listed relevant information!

Keep in mind that if you're not using a Substratum supported ROM, my means of providing support and fixing bugs are rather limited.

Don't report bugs by writing it in a review on google play, it's unlikely that I will look into it this way! REVIEWS ARE NOT FOR BUG REPORTS!

Source code

This theme was made open source, so anybody has the possibility to improve it! Code can be found on github.

Previous releases

If you experience some issues with the latest version that weren't present before, or you'd like to try out previous releases of this theme for other reasons, you can get them on the github releases page.

Substratum not found!

This theme was created for the Substratum theming solution.
This means that it will not provide any functionality on its own, but work in an add-on style with the above mentioned app, developed by a different team of developers.
It seems like you have not installed the Substratum app on your device.
If you still want to use this theme, please try to get the Substratum app to work on your device first.

Unfortunately, Substratum will not work on all devices. Usually it requires a rooted device or a custom ROM with inbuilt Substratum support.

Please also keep in mind that for an optimal experience, a custom ROM with the required Substratum support is recommended.
This theme *might* also work on stock ROMs if they are close enough to the original Android code and Substratum works on them, but this is not officially supported.
